file_insights.changes_summary: Comprehensive responsive design overhaul for mobile and tablet viewports
key_modifications: Implemented mobile-first responsive layout using MUI breakpoints (xs, sm, md)
Separated mobile and desktop date display with conditional rendering
Restructured card content from row-based to column-based layout on mobile
Added responsive spacing adjustments (gap, padding, margins)
Applied responsive sizing to avatar components and select inputs
Reorganized timeline structure to accommodate vertical stacking on small screens

patterns_discovered.description: Uses MUI's sx prop with breakpoint objects (xs, sm, md) to define responsive values
Uses display property with breakpoints to show/hide elements across device sizes
examples: Date shown above card on mobile (display: { xs: 'block', sm: 'none' })
Date shown on left side on desktop (display: { xs: 'none', sm: 'block' })

patterns_discovered.description: Consistent use of responsive gap and padding objects across components
CardContent restructured from row (flex direction) to column layout on mobile

gotchas_discovered.description: Avatar width/height changed from fixed 40 to responsive { xs: 36, sm: 40 }
gotchas_discovered.impact: Ensures proportional sizing on smaller screens, prevents overflow

gotchas_discovered.description: Added wrapper Box for avatar and text group to handle responsive flexing independently
gotchas_discovered.impact: Prevents layout shifts when switching between row and column directions

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Skeleton loading states must match responsive structure
gotchas_discovered.description: Skeleton components were updated alongside actual content to maintain visual consistency during loading
gotchas_discovered.impact: Prevents layout thrashing between loading and loaded states

gotchas_discovered.description: Applies minWidth: { xs: '100%', sm: 200 } to Select/Skeleton components
gotchas_discovered.impact: Ensures controls don't exceed viewport width on mobile devices

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully transformed InspectionHistoryTimeline component into a fully responsive design supporting mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports
key_achievements: Eliminated horizontal overflow on mobile devices
Created separate layouts for mobile (vertical stacking) and desktop (horizontal timeline)
Maintained visual hierarchy and component functionality across all screen sizes
Updated both loading and loaded states to be responsive
approach_outcome.approach_used: Progressive enhancement using MUI breakpoint system with mobile-first strategy
approach_outcome.challenges_overcome: Restructured complex nested layout (date + timeline node + card) to accommodate different visual arrangements per breakpoint

recommendations.recommendation: Implement responsive visual regression tests at breakpoints xs (320px), sm (600px), md (900px) to prevent future responsive design regressions
Verify that hidden elements (display: none) are properly hidden from screen readers and that date information is accessible on mobile despite visual repositioning
Consider using CSS media queries directly instead of sx prop for frequently-changing responsive styles to reduce re-render overhead
Extract responsive breakpoint values (e.g., { xs: 100%, sm: 200 }) into constants to maintain consistency and simplify future updates
Document the responsive behavior expectations for InspectionHistoryTimeline in component JSDoc to guide future maintainers
